metadata.title: CVE-2021-35942 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 maycrash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) whencalled with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in adenial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoiwas used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations.

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
